docs.lead_paragraph: Do drugs for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder need to be taken for life? Are they dangerous? Are there alternatives to medications? There are among the questions posed by readers of the Consults blog. Dr. Russell A. Barkley, clinical professor of psychiatry at the Medical University of South Carolina and author, most recently, of "Taking Charge of Adult A.D.H.D.," responds.

headline.main: A.D.H.D.: To Medicate or Not to Medicate?

docs.abstract: Dr. Russell Barkley responds to reader questions about attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder.
docs.snippet: Dr. Russell Barkley responds to reader questions about attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder.

docs.lead_paragraph: 7:16 p.m. | Updated PARIS - The French drug maker Sanofi-Aventis said on Wednesday that it had agreed to buy the American biotechnology company Genzyme for at least $20.1 billion in cash, with additional payments possible based on the performance of Genzyme's drugs.

headline.main: French Drug Maker to Buy Genzyme for $20.1 Billion

docs.abstract: Sanofi-Aventis agrees to buy Genzyme for at least $20.1 billion in cash, with additional payments possible based on the performance of Genzyme's drugs (M)
docs.snippet: 7:16 p.m. | Updated      PARIS - The French drug maker Sanofi-Aventis said on Wednesday that it had agreed to buy the American biotechnology company Genzyme for at least $20.1 billion in cash, with additional payments possible based on the...

headline.main: Sanofi Agrees to Buy Genzyme for $20.1 Billion

docs.abstract: The deal ends months of haggling after Sanofi-Aventis unsuccessfully sought to acquire Genzyme for $18.5 billion.
docs.snippet: The deal ends months of haggling after Sanofi-Aventis unsuccessfully sought to acquire Genzyme for $18.5 billion.
